main event: On May 21, 1953, in Kansas City, Missouri, a military source reported the sighting of three egg-shaped transparent objects resembling balloons. The objects were seen traveling in a SSW direction at a high rate of speed and high altitude for approximately 10 minutes.
interesting points: The source believed that the objects were aircraft, possibly due to hearing aircraft noises in the sky and trying to locate the aircraft.
The objects were described as transparent, resembling balloons, but with peculiar maneuvers ruling out weather balloons as a possibility.
The report included sketches of the objects, but no photographs were present in the document.
A diagram was requested from the witness to show the path and motion of the object or objects during the sighting.
The witness, a Master Sergeant in the USAF, provided information about his educational training and job, indicating expertise in dealing with guided missiles.
sighted object: three egg-shaped transparent objects resembling balloons
